Al- though he was in retirement and had now no influence in political affairs, every high official appointed to the province in which the prince's estate lay considered it his duty to visit him and waited in the lofty antechamber just as the ar- chitect, gardener, or Princess Mary did, till the prince appeared punctually to the appointed hour.
